description: Temporary use as Class B8 (Storage or Distribution) of the land for a period of up to 2 years
decision_conditions: The temporary use hereby approved shall be discontinued and the temporary development shall be removed at the end 2 years from the date of this decision and the land shall be reinstated to its prior condition.

Reason: In order that the local planning authority may assess the impact of the use at the end of the limited period hereby permitted, having regard to any complaints received and any other material considerations existing at the time, and to comply with section 8 of the National Planning Policy Framework (2023), policy 7B of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan 2013, policy 1.1 (g) of the Ealing Development (Core) Strategy 2012 and the London Plan (2021).

| The development hereby approved shall be carried out in accordance with drawing title numbers: Planning Statement March 2024, Transport Statement 13 June 2024, Travel Plan Statement dated 18.06.2024, Site and Operations Management Plan rev B dated 22.07.2024, Site Location Plan 24112-MA-XX-XX-DR-C-0003 - P01, General Arrangement 24112-MA-XX-XX-DR-C-0101 - P04, Boundary Plan 24112-MA-XX-XX-DR-C-0001 - P03.
Reason: For the avoidance of doubt, and in the interests of proper planning.

| The Travel Plan Statement by Markides Associates, Rev. A dated 18/06/2024, shall be implemented in full, and that all activities associated with the site will be controlled and managed according to the plan.

Reason:   To promote sustainable patterns of transport, safeguard the living and working conditions of local people, and ensure highway and pedestrian safety in accordance with the National Planning Policy Framework (2023) and policies T1, T2, T3, T4, T5, T6 and T7 of the London Plan (2021); and 1.2 and 1.2 of the Ealing Development (Core) Strategy 2026 (2012).

| The Site and Operations Management Plan by Markides Associates, Rev. B dated 22/07/2024, shall be implemented in full, ensuring that the site will not be accessed outside the hours of 0800-2100 Monday - Saturday, 0900-1600 on Sundays and Bank Holidays and that all activities associated with the site will be controlled and managed according to the plan.

Reason: In the interests of the living conditions of the neighbours of the site in accordance with policies 7A and policy 7B of Ealing's Development Management DPD (2013), policy D14 and SI1 of the London Plan (2021), policy 1.1 (j) of the Ealing Development (Core) Strategy (2012), Standard 30 London Housing SPG 2016 and National Planning Policy Framework (2023).

| Within 3 months of date of decision, 16 long-stay cycle parking spaces and 8 short-stay cycle parking spaces shall be provided within the curtilage of the development. The long-stay cycle parking spaces shall be within secure, lockable compounds in accordance with all adopted standards prior to the first use of the extension hereby approved. The cycle spaces shall be permanently retained thereafter.
Reason: To provide adequate bicycle storage in accordance with policy Ealing's sustainable transport SPD and T5 of the London Plan (2021).

| Within 3 months of date of decision, the approved internal 1.2m width demarcated pedestrian route throughout the site to separate pedestrian and vehicular movements shall be provided in accordance with the designated locations identified in the approved drawings listed under condition 2. The demarcated pedestrian route shall be permanently retained for the lifetime of the development.

Reason:   To ensure highway and pedestrian safety in accordance with the National Planning Policy Framework (2023) and policies T1, T2, T3, T4, T5, T6 and T7 of the London Plan (2021); and 1.2 and 1.2 of the Ealing Development (Core) Strategy 2026 (2012).
